thread.title: Chinese pensioner dives into the sea over 200 times a day
thread.title_full: Chinese pensioner dives into the sea over 200 times a day | Daily Mail Online

author: Qin Xie For Mailonline
title: Chinese pensioner dives into the sea over 200 times a day
text:
5 shares 1
View
comments
A pensioner's passion for diving has turned him into a regular tourist attraction.
Zhang Quantong has been diving off a pier in Qingdao, eastern China, almost everyday for more than a decade, reported People's Daily Online .
The 73-year-old can make over 200 dives a day, adding up to over 17,000 times a year.
The 73-year-old can make over 200 dives a day, adding up to over 17,000 times a year. He even dives in winter
He also power walks three miles a day, does hand stands and completes 100 exercises on parallel bars
 Next Chinese villager who hacked wife and eight family members to... Chinese toddler hospitalised with parasitic infection after... Zhang Quantong's unusual hobby has gained him a large following and a crowd always turns out for his dives.
Speaking about his hobby, Zhang said: 'I've been diving for more than 10 years. Even if I just miss one day's diving I will feel uncomfortable.
'Before I go out for a dive, I always do the warm up at home. I also do 100 exercises on the parallel bars each day.'
Incredibly, he also takes 3 mile power walks and does handstands each day to keep fit.
Zhang Quantong (above) has been diving off a pier in Qingdao, China, almost everyday for more than a decade
Zhang said: 'I've been diving for more than 10 years. Even if I just miss one day's diving I will feel uncomfortable'
Zhang Quantong has been a fitness fanatic for a long time.
Even in his younger days, he's kept fit with winter swims and triathlons.
In 2003, he decided to start a diving team in the local area with some friends, all of whom are said to be in their 60s.
What started out as just 'fooling around' has turned into regulation dives.
For the 2008 Olympics, Zhang even challenged himself to dive 208 times in a single day.
Zhang's routine has kept him incredibly fit.
In 2003, he decided to start a diving team in the local area with friends, all of whom are said to be in their 60s
It's important to know the water before attempting a dive and Zhang always stops tourists from trying their hand
The only time he's been in hospital in the last few years has been when he was involved in a car accident in March 2014.
Despite having to use crutches in the months following the accident, nothing could stop him from diving again just 100 days later in July.
He said: 'In reality, if you put your mind to it, you can keep fit with any exercise. Everyone is the same.'
However, when tourists want to try their hand at diving, he always stops them.
He explains, 'When I dive, I always arrive when the tide is in and leave when the tide goes out.
'If you don't have the experience, don't dive in blind. If you don't know where the hidden reefs are it can be very dangerous.
'But if anyone really wants to learn, I can always teach them.'
He added: 'As long as I can move, I will keep diving.'
The only time he's been in hospital in the last few years has been after a serious car accident in March 2014
Despite still having to use crutches, nothing could stop him from diving again after a traffic accident in 2014
